definition: to be fired up (idiom)/to have one's blood racing
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear

sentences.chinese: 我是乔热血沸腾的愤怒。

sentences.english: The news of Beijing successfully applied for Olympik Games mads us very excited.
sentences.chinese: 北京申请奥成功的消息令我们热血沸腾。

sentences.english: I felt alive. I felt full of blood.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得生机勃勃，热血沸腾。

sentences.english: By this time, my fighting blood was boiling.
sentences.chinese: 到这时候，我的热血沸腾起来。

sentences.english: The call put out by the Prime Minister enkindled our blood.
sentences.chinese: 总理的号召使我们热血沸腾。

sentences.english: His blood pounded as he knelt down before it. Raising his pale bare arm, he reached inside.
sentences.chinese: 他跪在那里，热血沸腾，将赤裸的白手臂伸进了洞里。

sentences.english: Every time I see the five-star red flag raising, I always feel blood boil.
sentences.chinese: 每次我看到五星红旗升起，我总会感到热血沸腾。

sentences.english: But don’t be fooled by its sleepy 1)appearance, there’s a lot more bubbling just beneath the surface.
sentences.chinese: 但别被它静寂的外表骗倒，沉静的表面下热血沸腾。

definition: eyes brimming with tears of excitement (idiom)/extremely moved
lit. blood vessels swell wide (idiom)/fig. one's blood runs quicker/to be excited
to stir oneself up/to raise one's spirits/to inspire
each new high point replaced by another/(of a movie etc) one climax after another
lit. heart alarmed, body leaping (idiom); fear and trepidation in the face of disaster
shaking one to the core/extremely disturbing/hair-raising (idiom)
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
